page.title: 07ROE AND SIKA DEER
page.content: Nearby are Oakley Wood and West Wood. They are traditional Dorset Woods of Hazel and Oak.The Hazel was once used for spars in thatching or made into sheep hurdles. The trees are also damaged by deer rubbing their antlers against the trunks.The deer do this when they are growing new antlers which are covered with an itchy'velvet'.Sika Deer were first brought to Brownsea Island,in Poole Harbour from Japan,some escaped by swimming to the mainland.Because there are so many deer a man comes from London each year to 'cull'the deer.This means shooting deer that are too old or ill. Game_keepers look after Pheasants and other wild life in the woods.Owls;Jays Chaffinch;Magpies;Robins;Blue and Lomg_tailed Tits are in the woods. Twice a year the Fox Hunt meets.
